en: [Letter] 1849 Feb. 26, Nashville, Tennessee [to] Neill Brown / Capitol Building Commission

This document is a brief note to governor Neill S. Brown, dated February 26, 1849 communicating a decision of the Board of Commissioners in charge of overseeing the construction of the state house in Nashville, to issue bonds of the state in the amount of fifty-thousand dollars for the construction of the building.

This document is a brief note to governor Neill S. Brown, dated February 26, 1849 communicating a decision of the Board of Commissioners in charge of overseeing the construction of the state house in Nashville, to issue bonds of the state in the amount of fifty-thousand dollars for the construction of the building.

none: [Letter] 1849 Feb. 26, Nashville, Tennessee [to] Neill Brown / Capitol Building Commission : page 1

body.value: Nashville Feby February 26 1849 At a meeting of the Board of Commissioners to superintend the construction of the state House, present Jno John M Bass , Wm William Brown , SD Morgan, James Woods and A A Hall, on motion it was Resolved, that the Governor of the State be requested to issue Bonds of the State to the amount of Fifty thousand Dollars pursuant to an act of the General assembly of this State entitled "an act to continue the construction of the State Capitol" passed January 24th 1848 and that he deliver the same to John M Bass Prest. of this Round of Commissioners who is hereby authorized to receipt for the same" Jno John W Bass Prest President of Board of Comissioners Commissioners The above is a true copy from the minutes N.A. Glennfeet
